org.vast.util

Class TimeExtent

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.vast.util.TimeExtent

  • public class TimeExtent
extends Object

    Class for storing the definition of a temporal domain. This can include a base time, time bias (deviation from base time), time step, and lead/lag time deltas.

    Since:
    Nov 15, 2005
    Author:
    Tony Cook, Mike Botts, Alexandre Robin

      • getBaseTime

        public double getBaseTime()
        To get baseTime without bias applied. If baseAtNow is set, this retrieves the system's current time
        Returns:
        base time as julian time in seconds (1970 based)

      • getAdjustedTime

        public double getAdjustedTime()
        To get baseTime or absTime with bias applied
        Returns:
        base time + bias as julian time in seconds (1970 based)

      • getTimes

        public double[] getTimes()
        Calculates times based on current time settings, always assuring that both endpoints are included even if an uneven time step occurs at the end
        Returns:
        time grid spliting the time period evenly

      • equals

        public boolean equals(TimeExtent timeExtent)
        Checks if time extents are equal (no null check) (i.e. stop=stop AND start=start)
        Parameters:
        timeExtent -
        Returns:
        true if time extents are equal

        public boolean intersects(TimeExtent timeExtent)

        Parameters:
        timeExtent -
        Returns:
        true if both TimeExtents intersects

      • isNull

        public boolean isNull()
        Check if time is null (i.e. baseTime is not set)
        Returns:
        true if no base time has been set

      • isTimeInstant

        public boolean isTimeInstant()
        Check if this is a single point in time
        Returns:
        true if this is a time instant

      • nullify

        public void nullify()
        Resets all variables so that extent is null (i.e. unset)

      • resizeToContain

        public void resizeToContain(double t)
        Resizes this extent so that it contains the given time value
        Parameters:
        t - time value (MUST be in same reference frame as the extent)
